title: The 40 most important players in college football this season
content: From QBs on surefire CFP contenders to potential stars looking to break through, these players will shape the 2025 season.

title: Sources: QB Bridgewater to sign with Buccaneers
content: Veteran NFL QB Teddy Bridgewater is visiting Tampa on Tuesday and is expected to sign with the Bucs, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Rams RB Williams signs 3-year, $33M extension
content: RB Kyren Williams, who had the NFL's highest touch rate last season, signed a 3-year, $33 million contract extension with the L.A. Rams with $23 million guaranteed.

title: Ex-NFL RB convicted for role in dogfighting outfit
content: LeShon Johnson -- who played for the Packers, Cardinals and Giants -- faces five years in prison after being convicted for his role in an Oklahoma dogfighting operation.

title: Sources: Banged-up Browns sign 5th QB in Huntley
content: The Browns are signing quarterback Tyler Huntley, sources said, adding depth with multiple passers nursing injuries.

title: Sources: Packers' Hobbs (knee) out rest of camp
content: Packers cornerback Nate Hobbs is expected to miss the remainder of training camp after having arthroscopic knee surgery to repair a meniscus tear, sources told ESPN, but could be back for the regular-season opener Sept. 7 against the Lions.

title: Sources: LeBron congratulated Luka on new deal
content: LeBron James congratulated Luka Doncic on his new three-year, $165 million contract extension via a video call Saturday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Goals king Ovechkin finds partner for movie rights
content: Capitals star Alex Ovechkin, the NHL's goal-scoring king, has partnered with a technology company to produce a movie, series or documentary about his career.

title: Masters hospitality packages to run up to $219K
content: A new "Official Masters Hospitality" program will be offering packages that can run upward of $219,600 for the week of the tournament.

title: üõëFantasy football: Do Not Draft list
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: 'He never wanted to leave': How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including De'Aaron Fox, Spurs max extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Latest buzz from NFL training camp: What we heard at 16 teams' practices, plus fantasy intel
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: Saints QB1 or not, Tyler Shough believes 'this is going to work out'
content: Expectations are high for the second-round pick, but the 26-year-old knows adversity and he's not backing away.

title: Confidence, conditioning and catches: What we've learned about Travis Hunter so far
content: The Jaguars' dual receiver and cornerback has had an eventful two weeks in his first NFL training camp.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with star injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without their stars.

title: Trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as contenders look upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Man United passed their preseason tests. Now comes the real challenge
content: It's going to take more than good vibes to get Man United back into the top half of the Premier League table.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Watkins linked with Man United amid Sesko pursuit
content: Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins could head to Manchester United, in the event that a move for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: Regional rivalries, freshmen debuts and more of the most intriguing nonconference game to tune into for each preseason top 25 team.

content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Can Bar√ßa's title defense endure summer of self sabotage?
content: It's been one misstep after another for Barcelona, but on the field they're so strong it may not matter.

title: Missed wages, closed stand, quitting players: Why Sheffield Wednesday could go bust
content: Sheffield Wednesday are one of the most historically important clubs in England, but they could cease to exist.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and the Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 QBs in Madden NFL 26
content: From Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson to Jayden Daniels, here are the top 10 quarterbacks in Madden NFL 26

title: Kolhapur elephant row: Maharashtra government to file a review petition in SC over animal‚Äôs transfer to Vantara
content: Chief Minister Fadnavis says a special team will be formed to care for elephant Madhuri after her return from the rescue/rehabilitation centre

title: PMK¬†senior leaders believe voters, and not office-bearers, will decide the party leadership
content: Both factions have started talking with other parties to ensure that they remain in pole position. While Dr.¬†Anbumani¬†has embarked on a padayatra, focusing on the¬†PMK¬†strongholds and presenting himself as the face of the party, Dr.¬†Ramadoss, 86, is headlining a women‚Äôs conference at¬†Poompuhar¬†on August 10

title: Vacancies unfilled, UPSC to alert institutions about government jobs
content: The UPSC Chairman said that ‚Äúposts remained vacant or became infructuous during the interview stage as suitable candidates are not found by the interview board‚Äù

title: Army says no ceasefire violation along LoC
content: ‚ÄúThere have been some media and social media reports regarding ceasefire violation in Poonch region. It is clarified that there has been no ceasefire violation along the LoC. Please avoid spreading unverified information,‚Äù the Army said in a statement.

title: Two-day seminar in State capital to focus on tribal life and knowledge
content: Workshop brings together activists, scholars, artists, ethnic food experts, tribal healers, and community representatives from Kerala and beyond. It aims at providing a comprehensive understanding of tribal life, with a focus on cultural, ecological, and socio-political dimensions

title: Caste killing: investigation will be completed in 60 days, Tamil Nadu government informs High Court
content: An interim compensation of ‚Çπ6¬†lakh¬†has already been handed over to the family. A case has been booked under the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act. No offender will be allowed to go scot free, says the government

title: Go beyond politics to work towards improving city‚Äôs infrastructure, urges Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The Union Minister said rail connectivity within the city and to the city from outside will be doubled in the next three years

title: Madras High Court orders disciplinary action against five IPS officers for dereliction of duty
content: Justice P. Velmurugan also orders initiation of departmental action against 11 Inspectors who had served at Kullanchavadi police station in Cuddalore district since 2015

title: Amaravati hackathon to promote culture of innovation and problem-solving
content: Registration for the event started and August 12 is the last day for submission of ideas by college teams on AQVH 2025 portal

title: Allahabad HC judge has made a mockery of justice, says Supreme Court
content: The apex court reprimands Justice Prashant Kumar, says he found nothing wrong in a litigant filing a criminal case against a buyer in a purely civil dispute over an unpaid balance of money in a sale transaction

title: BDA gets approval to form six new layouts along PRR-2
content: Apart from planned development along the new road, these layouts are also being taken up to compensate land losers to the road project with developed land along the road.

title: Karnataka High Court directs State government to submit Commission report on Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede ¬†¬†
content: We also organised RCB team‚Äôs facilitation on the steps of Vidhana Soudha upon Government‚Äôs request, DNA Networks tells Court

title: Two women dead, three injured in fall at religious gathering in Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Sehore
content: Police attribute incident to crowding at Kubereshwar Dham during Rudraksha distribution; no stampede reported

title: Non-lowering of national flag after sunset in itself is not an offence, says Kerala HC
content: Court quashes criminal proceedings against Secretary of Angamaly municipality for allegedly not lowering the flag at the municipal office for almost two days after Independence Day in 2015

title: Internal quota: panel proposes 6% for Dalit left, 5% for Dalit right
content: H.N. Nagamohan Das panel is learnt to have created a separate group for Adi Karnataka, Adi Dravida and Adi Andhra, providing 1% reservation for the three

title: On eve of global plastic talks, DMK MP pushes India to take ‚Äòlead role‚Äô
content: The meeting should make way for legally binding obligations that span the entire life cycle of plastics, Thamizhachi Thangapandian suggests in her letter to the Environment Minister

title: Urea ‚Äòsmuggling‚Äô: BJP demands probe and White Paper on supply situation
content: ‚ÄòThe shocking seizure of urea being smuggled from Karnataka to Kerala is not just illegal; it is also a direct betrayal of Karnataka‚Äôs farmers‚Äô

title: Bengaluru largely unfazed as RTC strike disrupts bus services across Karnataka
content: As of 6 p.m., the overall operational rate of four corporations across the State stood at 71.9%, with major variations in performance among the four State-run transport corporations

title: Amid tariff row, Army shares 1971 newspaper clipping highlighting U.S. arms supply to Pakistan
content: Article published on August 5, 1971 quotes a Minister telling Parliament that the U.S. had shipped arms worth $2 billion to Pakistan since 1954, adding that the U.S. and China supplied Pakistan with arms at concessional rates

title: ED attaches assets worth ‚Çπ42.8 crore in cyber fraud accused arrested in U.S.
content: Properties linked to U.S.-arrested accused Chirag Tomar, his family and entities traced to cyber fraud

title: Congress leaders in New Delhi to expedite reorganisation process
content: KPCC president Sunny Joseph, Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan, and United Democratic Front convener Adoor Prakash hold marathon meetings with MPs, reportedly to ease purported intra-party tensions over recasting district congress committees

title: If Stalin has given good administration, then why hold outreach programmes: Palaniswami ¬†
content: The former Chief Minister lashes out at the DMK government for closing down 2,000 pro-poor ‚ÄòAmma Mini Clinics‚Äô and discontinuing distribution of laptops to schoolchildren

title: Transport workers‚Äô stir triggers political slugfest between CM and LoP in Karnataka
content: While Ashok blamed Siddaramaiah for the staff going on a strike, the latter shot back saying that it was when Mr. Ashok was the Transport Minister that the transport staff had gone on a 15-day strike as they were not being paid their salaries fully then

title: Man sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for setting nephew ablaze
content: George Titus of Kulathoor falsely accused the then Class VI student of stealing money from a neighbour, poured kerosene on him and set him on fire

title: Thoothukudi Basilica‚Äôs 11-day annual feast concludes with a grand car procession
content: On Monday, Thoothukudi Bishop Most Rev. Stephen Antony led the vespers, the special evening prayers, and the feast mass on Tuesday after a series of Holy Masses since 4.30 a.m.

title: Shibu Soren cremated at native village Nemra
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge and party leader Rahul Gandhi also reached his village to attend the funeral of the veteran tribal leader

title: Officials told to speed-up land acquisition for Polavaram R&R, NH projects
content: The Collector emphasises that Gram Sabhas must be held in all concerned villages after identifying land parcels, says officials, including RDOs and DSPs, should participate and engage with farmers transparently during these public hearings

title: Loans at 4% interest rate for women to promote entrepreneurship in tourism sector in Kerala
content: Enterprises registered under the women-friendly scheme of the Responsible Tourism Mission to be eligible

title: New study by IISc researchers reveals how reward modulates attention in humans
content: The experiment examines how the expectation of a reward modulates the two key components of attention: sensitivity and bias

title: T.N. Minister lays foundation stone for restoration of 128-year-old Collectorate building in Cuddalore
content: Spread over 44,960 sq.feet, the 128-year-old red brick structure has suffered damage due to ageing, particularly the Madras tile roofing and the walls. A preliminary assessment revealed that the building‚Äôs condition was stable

title: Construction of KGS Units 5, 6  picks pace; first pour of concrete to commence by November
content: The project cost of ‚Çπ21,000 for the two units will be released over a period of five years, says Kaiga Site Director B. Vinod Kumar

title: Assam BJP leader slams Malviya over ‚ÄòBangladeshi language‚Äô row
content: Defending a Delhi Police communique on ‚Äútranslation of documents containing text in Bangladeshi language‚Äù, the BJP‚Äôs IT cell chief said Sylheti was ‚Äúnearly incomprehensible to Indian Bengalis‚Äù

title: Handloom sector gets a major boost in Andhra Pradesh
content: Government decides to bear GST on handloom textiles, besides giving 200 units of power free of cost to traditional looms and 500 units to powerlooms; the decisions will come into effect from August 7, which is observed as National Handloom Day

title: 40 people freed from bonded labour in Prakasam district
content: District administration officials track the victims with the help of voluntary organisations and rescued them on Monday

title: Decoding the success of ‚ÄòSu From So‚Äô | Raj B Shetty | JP Thuminad
content: A video essay decoding the success of the film ‚ÄòSu from So‚Äô and how it can help Kannada cinema flourish.

title: Revenue Minister inaugurates Bhu Suraksha Yojane, project aimed at digitising all base land records
content: Krishna Byre Gowda says there are an estimated 100-crore pages of land records in the State that need to be scanned. We have completed scanning 36.35-lakh pages so far, and the remaining will be done at the earliest, he says

title: KTU decides to waive year-out system for UG programmes this year
content: Issue, which potentially affected several students under the 2019 regulations, had triggered protests recently

title: Yellow Line Metro project belongs to people, not to any political party or govt. alone: DKS
content: Deputy Chief Minister says it is a joint partnership between the State and Union governments, and the focus here is to serve the people

title: 'India not good trading partner': Trump says will raise tariffs substantially in 24 hrs
content: US Presdient Donald Trump has declared his intention to significantly increase tariffs on India, citing country's purchase of Russian oil. He accuses India of profiting by reselling Russian oil while disregarding the conflict in Ukraine.

title: 'Before Ramadan': Yunus announces Feb 2026 Bangladesh elections
content: Interim Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus announced Bangladesh's general elections will be held in February 2026, following consultations with political parties. The announcement coincided with the release of the "July Declaration," outlining proposed reforms and criticizing the previous administration. While celebrations marked the anniversary of Sheikh Hasina's ouster, Human Rights Watch raised concerns about the interim government's human rights record.

title: Jasprit Bumrah's 'what's next' post keeps fans wondering
content: India and England concluded a captivating Test series with a 2-2 draw. The final match saw India secure a narrow six-run victory at The Oval. Shubman Gill led the team, while Mohammed Siraj topped the bowling charts. Jasprit Bumrah expressed his satisfaction with the competitive series. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Harry Brook shone with centuries.

title: Uttarakhand floods: At least 10 Army jawans missing in Harshil
content: Tragedy struck Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district as cloudbursts triggered devastating flash floods in Harsil, leaving at least ten Army personnel missing. Rescue operations are underway, with the Air Force on standby to assist. The Kheer Ganga river overflowed, causing extensive damage in Dharali village, a key stop for Gangotri pilgrims.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing Meta's $1 Bn job offer; CEO Zuckerberg launched...
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: KL Rahul's powerful post for two gutsy players goes viral
content: KL Rahul lauded Rishabh Pant and Chris Woakes for their unwavering dedication and courage while playing through pain for their respective countries. Pant battled a foot injury in the fourth Test, returning to bat with a bandage and scoring a half-century. Similarly, Woakes, despite a shoulder injury, emerged to bat in the final Test, showcasing remarkable grit and determination.

title: From oil to outrage: How India plans to counter Trump‚Äôs tariff threat
content: Donald Trump threatened to raise tariffs on Indian goods due to continued Russian oil purchases, despite India's offer of zero tariffs on American products. This escalation could significantly impact Indian exports and derail trade negotiations. India is devising strategies, including sectoral support, dairy diplomacy, and strategic messaging, to mitigate economic fallout and stabilize relations amidst Trump's pressure.

title: Delhi-Milan Air India flight aborted moments before take-off
content: Air India cancelled flight AI137 from Delhi to Milan on Tuesday due to a maintenance issue discovered in the Boeing 787 Dreamliner before takeoff. The airline is working to minimize passenger inconvenience by arranging alternative flights, hotel stays, and offering full refunds or free rescheduling. Recent weeks have seen Air India facing multiple flight disruptions due to technical problems.

title: Trump says will announce new tariff plan for semiconductors and chips next week
content: Donald Trump plans to impose new tariffs on semiconductor and chip imports to boost US manufacturing. This follows a Commerce Department investigation into the semiconductor market. While smartphones and computers were previously excluded from higher tariffs, these new measures aim to incentivize domestic production.

title: Porto legend Jorge Costa dies aged 53
content: Jorge Costa, the former captain of Porto, tragically passed away at the age of 53 due to a cardiac arrest at the club's training ground. A key figure in Porto's history, he won eight league titles and the Champions League in 2004.

title: 'Tejashwi must be watching': Tej Pratap launches 5-party coalition; invites RJD
content: Lalu Prasad's son, Tej Pratap Yadav, started a new political front. He allied with Pradeep Nishad's VVIP. Tej Pratap was expelled from RJD. He invited RJD and Congress to join him. Pradeep Nishad had differences with Mukesh Sahani. Tej Pratap plans to contest from Mahua. He dismissed Tejashwi contesting from Mahua. The new political development creates ripples in Bihar politics.

title: Palantir CEO says college degrees don‚Äôt matter: ‚ÄòWe are asking people to‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Palantir CEO Alex Karp stated that college degrees hold little significance at the company, emphasizing that employee value is determined by skills and performance. Karp highlighted that individuals without degrees often contribute substantial value, sometimes exceeding that of degree holders.

title: 'Here am I. Send me': How Trump is using the Bible to justify deportations
content: Legal scholars also raised red flags. The Establishment Clause of the US Constitution prohibits government endorsement of religion. While DHS has not officially responded to requests for clarification, civil liberties groups are reportedly preparing to challenge the campaign in court.

title: Forgiveness for some: Trump limits student loan relief except for ICE agents
content: In America, the Trump administration is changing student loan forgiveness. It favors ICE agents with bonuses and loan relief. Simultaneously, it restricts debt relief for teachers and nonprofit workers. Organisations aiding immigrants or transgender youth may be excluded. Critics call it hypocrisy. The administration is also dismantling the SAVE Plan. This shift impacts Indian students pursuing education in the US.

title: Trinity Rodman shines: Magic Johnson praises Dennis Rodman‚Äôs daughter
content: Trinity Rodman marked her return from injury with a stunning game-winning goal for the Washington Spirit against the Portland Thorns, electrifying fans and earning praise from part-owner Magic Johnson. Despite a strained relationship with her father, Dennis Rodman, Trinity continues to excel, showcasing her talent and resilience on the field, adding to her impressive list of achievements.

title: Russell Wilson skips Ciara, opts for sons-only brunch ‚Äî gets booed at WWE SummerSlam
content: New York Giants quarterback Russell Wilson, enjoying a rare day off, spent quality time with his sons, Future and Win, starting with a heartwarming brunch. The trio then attended WWE SummerSlam at MetLife Stadium, where Wilson received a custom Giants-themed wrestling belt. Despite the warm welcome, the crowd unexpectedly booed Wilson when he appeared on the jumbotron.

title: Connor McDavid to Bruins: Insiders say move could guarantee Cup
content: Speculation intensifies around Connor McDavid's future as contract talks stall with the Edmonton Oilers. Amidst swirling rumors, the Boston Bruins have emerged as a potential suitor. Bruins insiders boldly predict a Stanley Cup victory if McDavid joins their ranks, deeming him a 'cheat code' akin to LeBron James in his prime.

title: ‚ÄòCultural misunderstanding 101‚Äô: Indian family‚Äôs havan in Texas invites firefighters
content: A Hindu housewarming ceremony in Texas took an unexpected turn when the Bedford fire department arrived, mistaking the traditional havan for a fire emergency. Viral footage shows firefighters inspecting the scene as the family performed the ritual.

title: Hulk Hogan snubbed grandkids: Brooke‚Äôs husband speaks out ‚Äî ‚Äòno interest‚Äô
content: Just days before his death at 71 from cardiac arrest, WWE icon Hulk Hogan reportedly reconciled with his estranged daughter, Brooke. A tearful conversation led to forgiveness, with both expressing their love and regrets. Despite this reconciliation, Brooke was reportedly not planning to attend her father's funeral. Hogan was also battling chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

title: Kerala schools plan to scrap backbenches: What this quiet reform could mean for classroom learning
content: Kerala is set to eliminate traditional backbenches in state-run schools, aiming to boost student confidence and equity. Inspired partly by the Malayalam film Sthanarthi Sreekuttan, the move challenges classroom hierarchies by promoting inclusive seating like U-shaped layouts. An expert panel will recommend alternatives as the state rethinks how physical space impacts learning outcomes and emotional wellbeing.

title: Voter list lapse: ECI suspends 4 Bengal officers over fake entries
content: The Election Commission of India took action against officials in West Bengal. Four officials got suspended for sharing elector roll database credentials. They shared it with unauthorized people. The action followed reports of wrongful additions to electoral rolls in Baruipur Purba. Disciplinary proceedings and FIRs are expected. This is due to potential criminal misconduct.

title: 15-year-old girl out for snacks shot dead in market by ‚Äòboyfriend‚Äô
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, a 15-year-old girl was fatally shot by her 20-year-old boyfriend in a crowded market area. The accused, who is currently absconding, allegedly fired multiple rounds at the girl in front of a clinic, leading to her death.

title: Why the Delhi School Education Bill is facing sharp criticism: A closer look at the 15% clause
content: The Delhi School Education Fee Regulation Bill, 2025, proposes a three-tier oversight system to regulate private school fee hikes. Though billed as a transparency measure, it faces criticism over a clause allowing up to 15% annual fee hikes without external approval. Parents‚Äô groups argue the provision empowers school managements disproportionately, risking further commercialisation in education.

title: Massive cloudburst in Uttarakhand: Entire village swept away; 4 dead, several missing
content: A cloudburst-triggered flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali village caused widespread devastation, sweeping away homes, shops, and roads. Rescue teams, including SDRF and Army personnel, are on-site conducting relief operations amid fears that laborers may be trapped. The Meteorological Department has issued warnings for continued heavy rainfall across Uttarakhand, particularly in hilly areas, until August 10.

title: Tougher checks for marriage-based Green Cards: US issues guidelines
content: USCIS has updated its policy manual to combat marriage fraud in family-based immigration, prompted by concerns over fraudulent applications and national security risks. The updated policy mandates comprehensive evidence of bona fide marriages and rigorous interviews. Individuals convicted of marriage fraud face imprisonment, fines, and deportation, reflecting stricter scrutiny and vetting procedures.

title: 'Right to choose': Russia backs India, rebukes Trump's tariff threat over crude oil
content: The Kremlin has defended India's right to choose its trading partners, criticizing Trump's threat to raise tariffs over Russian oil imports. India has rebuffed Trump's warning as "unjustified," asserting its oil purchases are driven by market conditions. India vowed to protect its interests, noting that the US and EU also trade with Russia.

title: 'Trump negotiating ceasefire baseless': Ex-India cricketer takes dig at England legend
content: Former Indian cricketer Wasim Jaffer has humorously dismissed viral rumours suggesting that Donald Trump intervened to broker peace between him and Michael Vaughan. Jaffer clarified on X that the reports are baseless, confirming that the social media banter with the former England captain will continue.

title: Meet space hurricanes: Polar plasma storms disrupt GPS; pose stealth threat to satellite
content: Space hurricanes, unlike typical geomagnetic disturbances, are stealthy threats to satellite systems, forming even when the sun is quiet. These swirling plasma vortices disrupt GPS accuracy, scramble satellite signals, and distort Earth‚Äôs magnetic field without warning. Their ability to bypass normal forecasting models makes them a hidden threat to global navigation and communication infrastructure, especially in remote polar regions.

title: Man films lion devouring prey; predator turns and charges at him ‚Äì watch video
content: A viral video captured a man's reckless encounter with a lion as he approached the animal devouring its prey to film it. The lion, sensing the intrusion, reacted aggressively, briefly pushing the man. The incident sparked outrage online, with many criticizing the man's dangerous stunt and highlighting the potential consequences for both human and animal safety.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs ‚Äòdealbreaker‚Äô resurfaces: clip stirs Taylor Swift buzz ‚Äî fans spot red flag
content: A video of Kansas City Chiefs' Travis Kelce from 2016 resurfaced. Before Taylor Swift, Kelce revealed his dating preferences. He appeared on 'Watch What Happens Live' and shared his views on relationships. Kelce said that being selfie-obsessed was a dealbreaker for him. The clip went viral as Kelce enjoys superstardom. His old remarks are now headline news.

title: US announces new visa rules! Business travellers may have to pay $15,000 in bonds soon
content: The Donald Trump administration is reviving a policy requiring visitors from countries with high visa overstay rates to pay bonds up to $15,000 for B-1 and B-2 visas. This year-long pilot program aims to ensure visitors depart on time.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Dominate' - Gautam Gambhir's bold message to Team India after victory in The Oval
content: Gautam Gambhir's leadership and Shubman Gill's captaincy inspired India to a thrilling six-run victory at The Oval, drawing the Test series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's five-wicket haul secured the win, India's narrowest ever in Test history. This triumph boosted India to third in the ICC World Test Championship standings, highlighting the team's evolving identity and promising future.

title: Father-in-law tips off cops about booze party in Surat hotel; all arrested
content: Surat police raided a hotel party at 'Weekend Address' following a tip about liquor consumption, arresting six individuals, including two female artists and four businessmen. The raid, triggered by a family dispute where a man reported his daughter-in-law's presence, led to the seizure of liquor and glasses.

title: Parliament extends President's Rule in Manipur by 6 months
content: Rajya Sabha approved extending President's Rule in Manipur for six more months due to ongoing unrest. Union minister Nityanand Rai moved the resolution, previously passed by Lok Sabha. This decision follows N Biren Singh's resignation as chief minister amidst violence between Meitei and Kuki-Zomi communities, displacing thousands.

title: To dodge Rs 6k bill, youths fake bone in veg biryani at Gorakhpur restaurant
content: In Gorakhpur, a group of young men tried to avoid paying their restaurant bill. They falsely claimed a bone was in their vegetarian biryani. The restaurant staff checked the CCTV footage. The footage revealed the youths planting the bone themselves. Police arrived to maintain order. No formal complaint has been filed by either party in this incident at Biryani Bae.

title: DU CSAS round 3 seat allocation results released: Check direct link to download list here
content: Delhi University has announced the Round 3 seat allocation for undergraduate admissions on August 5, 2025. Students can check their allotment status on admission.uod.ac.in. Those who want to apply through the Mid-Entry window can do so from August 8 to August 10. The final seat allotment list, including special categories, will be released on August 13.

title: CBSE Class 10 Supplementary Result 2025 released: Check marksheet
content: The CBSE declared the Class 10 Supplementary Exam Result 2025 on August 5, accessible on official websites and platforms like DigiLocker. Out of 1,38,898 students, 67,620 passed, resulting in an overall pass percentage of 48.68%. The board has announced the schedule for verification of marks, scanned copies of answer sheets, and re-evaluation, with online applications available soon.

title: 25 baby cobras in 15 days: MP school shuts classrooms; digs floors to end snake scare
content: A government girls' school in Madhya Pradesh is grappling with a cobra infestation, as 25 baby cobras have been found in the last two weeks. The alarming situation has forced the school to close classrooms, disrupting lessons for over 1000 students. Authorities are working to seal potential snake nests and ensure the safety of everyone.

title: 'Poora khol ... ': Owaisi's explosive comment on Mohammed Siraj
content: India secured a thrilling six-run victory against England in the final Test at The Oval, drawing the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's outstanding five-wicket haul in the second innings was pivotal, earning him Player of the Match. Shubman Gill, stepping in as captain, also shone, receiving the Player of the Series award for his exceptional performance.

title: 'She‚Äôs human too': Christian Coleman defends girlfriend Sha‚ÄôCarri Richardson
content: Sha‚ÄôCarri Richardson's arrest at Seattle airport after a dispute with Christian Coleman sparked headlines, but Coleman's empathetic response shifted the focus. He downplayed the incident, emphasizing Richardson's struggles and his decision not to press charges.

title: Moon reactor by 2030: Nasa‚Äôs 100-kilowatt power plan; China-Russia lunar race heats up
content: The US aims to build a nuclear reactor on the Moon by 2030. Sean Duffy leads this project for lunar energy independence. This plan counters China and Russia's lunar base. The reactor will power habitats and resource extraction. NASA also plans to replace the International Space Station. Contracts will be awarded to private companies.

title: 'Carried India without Virat, Rohit': Ex-Pak cricketer's remark on Shubman
content: Danish Kaneria lauded India's Test series performance against England, praising Shubman Gill's leadership in the absence of senior players. Gill's remarkable 754 runs and Mohammed Siraj's bowling prowess were pivotal. Akash Deep's crucial 66 and Jaiswal's century significantly contributed to India's thrilling victory, securing a 2-2 series draw.

title: 7-Year-Old Chennai Girl Mauled By Pit Bull, Doctors Recommend Plastic Surgery
content: A seven-year-old girl was severely mauled by a Pit Bull in Chennai's Tondiarpet on Monday, resulting in major injuries to her face and chin.

title: Gautam Adani Redesignated As Non-Executive Chairman Of Adani Ports
content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) -- part of the Adani Group -- on Tuesday said billionaire Gautam Adani has been redesignated from executive chairman to non-executive chairman with immediate effect.

title: Trump Administration To Formally Axe Elon Musk's 'Five Things' Email: Report
content: The Trump administration plans to formally axe a program launched by billionaire Elon Musk requiring federal employees to summarise their five workplace achievements from the prior week, two people familiar with the matter said.

title: Top Court Bars High Court Judge From Hearing Criminal Cases Till Retirement
content: In an unprecedented order, the Supreme Court has stripped criminal matters of the roster of a Allahabad High Court judge "till he demits office" after he "erroneously" upheld summons of criminal nature in a civil dispute.

title: Saffron Robes, Ash: Thieves Pose As Seers, Snatch Delhi Woman's Rings
content: Clad in saffron robes and ash on their foreheads, three men approached a woman in Delhi and made off with her rings.

title: 4 Dead, Many Missing As Flash Floods Wash Away Much Of Uttarakhand Village
content: Four people have died, scores are feared trapped under debris and nine Army personnel are missing after a cloudburst struck Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district this afternoon, triggering a mudslide and flash floods that swept through a village.

title: Delhi Makes Aadhaar Mandatory For Income Certificate: What It Means For You
content: If you're planning to apply for any government welfare scheme in Delhi, your Aadhar card is now a must. The Delhi government has made Aadhaar mandatory for issuing income certificates, a document required to access several financial benefits.

title: 9 Soldiers Feared Missing After Uttarakhand Army Camp Hit By Flash Floods
content: Nine soldiers are reportedly missing after an army camp in Uttarakhand's Harshil was hit by flash floods on Tuesday.

title: 5 Bangladeshi Nationals Living Illegally In Delhi Detained Near Red Fort: Cops
content: Five Bangladeshi nationals, who had been living in the national capital illegally, were apprehended near Red Fort, police said on Tuesday.

title: Australian Regulator Says YouTube, Others 'Turning Blind Eye' To Child Abuse Material
content: Australia's internet watchdog has said the world's biggest social media firms are still "turning a blind eye" to online child sex abuse material on their platforms, and said YouTube in particular had been unresponsive to its enquiries.

title: 48 Air Passengers Placed On 'No-Fly List' Till July 30 This Year: Centre
content: Minister of State for Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol has informed the Rajya Sabha that 48 people have been placed on the 'no-fly list' till July 30 this year.

title: Bride Dies By Suicide On Wedding Night In Andhra Pradesh
content: A pall of gloom has descended on a family in Somendepalli mandal of Penukonda in Satya Sai district of Andhra Pradesh after a 22-year-old bride, Harishitha, allegedly died by suicide on her wedding night.

title: Pakistan Police Arrests Over 200 Protestors Demanding Ex-PM Imran Khan's Release
content: Police arrested more than 200 supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday as they tried to hold rallies in cities throughout Pakistan to mark the second anniversary of Khan's arrest, a party spokesman and officials said.

title: "Rather Than Blaming Climate Change...": Expert On Uttarakhand Tragedy
content: As the devastating flash floods in Uttarkashi claim lives and livelihoods yet again, experts flagged the failure to implement an integrated early warning system for the Himalayan region.

title: Many Houses Gone: Before-After Pics Show Devastation In Uttarakhand Village
content: A wave of floodwater swept through Uttarakhand's Dharali village on Tuesday afternoon, amid heavy rains, wiping out everything that came in its way.

title: Trump Says US China Close To Trade Agreement, Will Meet Xi If Deal Is Struck
content: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday the US was close to a trade deal with China and that he would meet his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping before the end of the year if an agreement is struck.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Environment Ministry Notification, Junks Exemption Clause For Big Projects
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld the January 29 notification of the Ministry of Environment, struck down the contentious clause exempting certain large building and construction projects from prior environmental clearance.

title: "So Much Pressure": World Nearly Beat Polio But Missteps Aided Its Comeback
content: The World Health Organization and partners embarked on their polio campaign in 1988 with the bold goal of eradication - a feat seen only once for human diseases, with smallpox in 1980.

title: Newly-Wed Girl Arrested For Killing Husband To Be With Boyfriend In Jharkhand: Cops
content: A newly married teenager was held for allegedly murdering her husband with the connivance of her boyfriend in Jharkhand's Palamu district, police said on Tuesday.

title: Video: Heavy Rain Triggers Landslide Near Tunnel Of Sevoke-Rangpo Rail Project
content: Heavy rain triggered a landslide near a tunnel of the under-construction Sevoke-Rangpo railway project on Tuesday, an official said, maintaining that there was no casualty or loss of railway assets.
